alert.note: Alert for Durham; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 PM EDT, Another round of heavy rain has moved into the advisory area indicated by doppler radar and automated rain gauges. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches has fallen in the past 2 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, RDU International, Morrisville, William B Umstead State Park and Research Triangle.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
